column4: anyone know how to download samba3 through apt-get instead of samba4?  b/c every time I do a sudo apt-get install samba, it installs 4
sudo apt-cache search samba | grep -i samba3
see if it's there, i think i heard it isn't
ill check, why wouldn't it be?  The devs say on the wiki that samba4 shouldn't be used on a production server yet.  So I'm trying to use 3 and I can't? lol
i have no idea, that's what i heard someone talking about here.  they could be wrong
yah it isn't there
yeah i don't see it either
you might have to see their website
sooooo, any suggestions on how to install samba3?
http://www.samba.org/
hmmm Im thinking maybe I need to do an apt-get install samba, I may have been doing apt-get install samba4
would that solve my problem?
o ic
did you find samba3?
I think that is samba3.  The version number is 3.5.4
like from the site
do they offer a ppa?
yah, but ill just probably dl the package and install it manually
sounds good. hope it works out
